markers.name: Bryn Shander
markers.description: The largest settlement in Icewind Dale, a walled town that serves as the region's hub of trade and commerce.
markers.notable: Market square, Town walls, Speaker Duvessa Shane

markers.name: Targos
markers.description: A fishing town on the shores of Maer Dualdon, known for its hardy fishermen and knucklehead trout.
markers.notable: Fishing fleet, The Luskan Arms tavern

markers.name: Caer-Konig
markers.description: A small town on the southern shore of Lac Dinneshere, known for its castle ruins.
markers.notable: Castle ruins, Northern Light inn

markers.name: Caer-Dineval
markers.description: A small town on the shores of Lac Dinneshere, struggling with internal conflicts.
markers.notable: Caer-Dineval castle, Cult presence

markers.name: Easthaven
markers.description: A town that serves as a gateway to the eastern reaches of Icewind Dale.
markers.notable: The White Lady Inn, Ferry service

markers.name: Good Mead
markers.description: A small town famous for its honey mead and beekeeping.
markers.notable: Mead production, Beehives, Shrine of Bahamut

markers.name: Dougan's Hole
markers.description: A small knucklehead trout fishing village on the shore of Redwaters.
markers.notable: Fishing, Redwaters lake

markers.name: Bremen
markers.description: A lumber town in the western part of Icewind Dale.
markers.notable: Lumber mill, Wooden palisade

markers.name: Lonelywood
markers.description: A logging town surrounded by the Lonelywood Forest.
markers.notable: Logging, Surrounded by forest

markers.name: Termalaine
markers.description: A gem-mining town known for its valuable stones.
markers.notable: Gem mining, Underground tunnels

markers.name: Kelvin's Cairn
markers.description: The only mountain in Icewind Dale, rising 1,800 feet above the tundra. Home to various creatures and ancient secrets.
markers.notable: Mountain peak, Caves, Verbeeg lair

markers.name: Reghed Glacier
markers.description: A massive glacier that dominates the eastern part of Icewind Dale, constantly moving and reshaping the land.
markers.notable: Glacier caves, Ancient ice, Tribal burial grounds

markers.name: Sea of Moving Ice
markers.description: A treacherous expanse of shifting ice floes and icebergs to the west of Icewind Dale.
markers.notable: Ice floes, Icebergs, Dangerous navigation

markers.name: Spine of the World
markers.description: The southern mountain range that borders Icewind Dale, nearly impassable and full of dangers.
markers.notable: Mountain range, Passes, Monster lairs

markers.name: Maer Dualdon
markers.description: The largest lake in Icewind Dale, source of knucklehead trout and freshwater.
markers.notable: Largest lake, Knucklehead trout, Freshwater source

markers.name: Lac Dinneshere
markers.description: A deep, cold lake known for its excellent fishing and dangerous depths.
markers.notable: Deep lake, Excellent fishing, Cold waters

markers.name: Redwaters
markers.description: A smaller lake with reddish water, possibly from mineral deposits.
markers.notable: Red-colored water, Mineral deposits

markers.name: Id Ascendant
markers.description: A psionic research facility hidden beneath the ice, home to dangerous experiments.
markers.notable: Psionic experiments, Mind flayers, Hidden entrance

markers.name: Ythryn
markers.description: The lost Netherese city, frozen in time within the Reghed Glacier.
markers.notable: Ancient magic, Netherese ruins, Powerful artifacts

markers.name: Caves of Hunger
markers.description: A network of caverns beneath Kelvin's Cairn, home to unspeakable horrors.
markers.notable: Cave system, Monsters, Hidden treasures

markers.name: Black Cabin
markers.description: A mysterious cabin in the Lonelywood forest, home to strange magic.
markers.notable: Magical experiments, Isolated location, Dark secrets

markers.name: Dark Duchess
markers.description: A shipwreck on the shores of Maer Dualdon, now a landmark and source of salvage.
markers.notable: Shipwreck, Salvage, Local landmark

markers.name: Tribe of the Elk
markers.description: A nomadic Reghed tribe that follows the great elk herds across the tundra.
markers.notable: Nomadic tribe, Elk herders, Seasonal migration

markers.name: Tribe of the Wolf
markers.description: A fierce Reghed tribe known for their wolf companions and hunting prowess.
markers.notable: Wolf companions, Hunters, Fierce warriors

markers.name: Tribe of the Bear
markers.description: The largest and most powerful of the Reghed tribes, known for their strength.
markers.notable: Largest tribe, Great strength, Bear totems

markers.name: Tribe of the Tiger
markers.description: A cunning Reghed tribe that values stealth and strategy over brute force.
markers.notable: Stealth tactics, Strategic thinking, Tiger spirits

markers.name: Ten-Trail
markers.description: The main road connecting the Ten-Towns, well-traveled but dangerous in winter.
markers.notable: Main road, Trade route, Winter dangers

markers.name: Eastway
markers.description: A dangerous path leading east toward the Reghed Glacier and beyond.
markers.notable: Eastern route, Glacier access, Dangerous travel

markers.name: Dwarven Valley
markers.description: A hidden valley in the Spine of the World, home to a small dwarven community.
markers.notable: Hidden valley, Dwarven settlement, Mountain refuge

markers.name: Jarlmoot
markers.description: Ancient meeting grounds where the Reghed tribes gather for important ceremonies.
markers.notable: Tribal meetings, Ancient grounds, Sacred ceremonies
